column4: yes ive heardof wine and cedega and virtual box even, but LAGGING is akin to murder in starcraft
In my experience, Starcraft runs very well under Wine (no lag at all)
I've also done warcraft 3 and a few first person shooters in Wine. Competitively. Lag was not an issue.
:  However, it's not always easy to set up. And if you don't use nVidia graphics with their binary driver, you'll likely get crappy performance no matter what.
